page.title: 11THE WARING TREAT
page.content: "Walking Days" (or Processions of Witness) associated with the churches are very common.In Heskin on St James' Day the governors of Pemberton's Grammar school, Heskin expected the children to walk to Eccleston Church carrying flowers. Tea provided on return to school. Lapsed then was revived in 1914 when Sir Halburt J. Waring left money to pay for this annual event. Bequest provides 18.00 per year. Tradition maintained. Cost is now 100.00. Third Saturday in June. Prizegiving takes place. Children provide entertainment, followed by a party tea.
